column1: Uchi////For those growing up with Asian food
column2: the flavors at Uchi aren't going to dazzle you-- sure
column4: but you'll definitely be paying more for the atmosphere and presentation than anything else. We had braised veal cheek
column5: and it tasted like the meat from Taiwanese beef noodle soup (albeit prettier presentation!). Â The crunchy tuna roll was tasty
column6: but not something impossible to find outside of the establishment~ ^^' ham and egg roll was different
column8: but I would never crave it.
